Generalplan Ost - Gotengau: Phase One

The initial stages of our settlement of Gotengau have been completed. From his ancient Gothic castle in Theodorichshafen, Himmler has overseen the development of his personal SS fiefdom. German settlers have gladly embraced the idealized lifestyle of the rural Wehrbauer, warrior-peasants who have instilled their blood into the soil of these lands. A great sense of purpose and fulfillment drives their efforts to civilize the countryside as they bring in their families to live among them, along with creating new ones. Tasked with both defending their farmsteads from native savagery and cultivating the soil, this lifestyle is destined to create Germanic volk of the most refined spirit and stock.\n \n"It's the greatest piece of colonization the world will ever have seen linked with a noble and essential task, the protection of the Western world against an eruption from Asia. When he has accomplished that, the name of Adolf Hitler will be the greatest in Germanic history - and he has commissioned me to carry out the task." - Heinrich Himmler
We are the torchbearers of civilization.
Generalplan Ost - Gotengau: Phase Two

The German colonization of Ukraine was specified as the top priority in Adolf Hitler's vision for the future of his eastern conquests. After establishing our foothold on the Crimean peninsula, we have expanded our settlements onto the banks of the Azov. The Wehrbauer have established a sufficient level of control in the region to begin developing the land. Within only a few decades, these plantations will feed all of Europe under the auspices of our New Order.
 
Germanization of the Dnieper is fundamental to consolidating our control over Ukraine, which is to become the breadbasket of Europe. The Zhytomyr Commissariat is the centerpiece of the foodsource of our new civilization. Ethnic Germans that were already living in the area at the time of our conquest have been elevated in the local society as administrators and governors of the growing farms in the area.
 
The "chornozem" (black earth) of the Ukrainian steppes, combined with the climate of the region make it uniquely suited to the growth of agricultural crops and grain in particular. Throughout the centuries, these fertile plains have been the target of countless foreign conquests. The German annexation of this land will be the very last time it needs to suffer at the hands of destructive warfare. "Zhytomyr," a compound word meaning "rye-peace" or "wheat-universe," is one of the most precious acquisitions from our war against Bolshevism.
We will find the salvation of Europe in this black earth.
Generalplan Ost - Gotengau: Phase Three

After years of investing blood, sweat, raw materials, labor and time, the Asiatic steppes of Ukraine are finally well underway in their process of Germanization. From the west bank of the Dnieper to the borders of Transnistria, the jewel of the Reich is beginning to shine. Agricultural output from these fertile plains alone will be enough to feed tens of millions of Europeans. We expect that in 20 to 30 years, export of grains and other foodstuffs will be well over 10 million tons of output annually.\n \n"There is only one task: Germanization through the introduction of Germans [to the area] and to treat the original inhabitants like Indians. ... I intend to stay this course with ice-cold determination. I feel myself to be the executor of the will of History. What people think of me at present is all of no consequence. Never have I heard a German who has bread to eat express concern that the ground where the grain was grown had to be conquered by the sword. We eat Canadian wheat and never think of the Indians." - Adolf Hitler
We see the jewel, not the polish required to make it shine.
Generalplan Ost - Gotengau: Phase Four

As our civilizing touch spans from Himmler's stronghold in Theodorichshafen up to the outskirts of the former city of Kiev, glimmers of the future of this region are beginning to shine through.
 
Abundant wheat crops are being harvested as German families finally feel secure on their new soil. Young couples are finding fulfilling lives on communal farms, overjoyed at their chance for an idyllic lifestyle on these rich plains. The far bank of the Dnieper is now firmly under our control, establishing this important river as the fertile spring that nourishes the Reich.
 
We expect that it will only take another year or so for the Gotengau colonization zone to be of sufficient Germanization to be incorporated directly into the Reich. For now, we must stay the course - the future of all civilization depends on this mission.
Future generations will owe their existence to this bounty.
Generalplan Ost - Gotengau: Final Integration
Our colonization of Ingermannland has reached the level where we can turn over this territory to be integrated into the Reich.
The Reichskommissariat has succeeded in its goals!
Generalplan Ost - Memel-Narew: Phase One

The area contained within the German administrative division of Bialystok compromised a large portion of the former state of Poland, with the city of Bialystok as its center of governance. Unlike other Polish territories that were either annexed into the Reich or brought under the administration of the Generalgouvernement to the south, Bialystok was placed under civil administration and was not incorporated directly into the German state. The district had significant strategic value as a bridgehead on the far bank of the Memel river, which played a major role in the logistics of the invasion of the Soviet Union.\n \nNow that the war on the eastern front is over, Bialystok and its surrounding territory has been incorporated into the Reich. The Third Partition of Poland in 1795 included this as a concession to Prussia, giving us legitimacy in our claims. Its direct border with the eastern frontier made it a natural choice for expansion in the 18th century, and that is still the case today. With the help of Dutch settlers and resettled Germans from other areas, this land is now fully under our control and well underway to complete Germanization.
Another historical injustice has been corrected.
Generalplan Ost - Memel-Narew: Phase Two

The territory of Lithuania has, at various points in the history of the Germanic people, been the target of our natural expansion towards the east. In 1915, the German aristocrat Silvio von Broed-rich-Kurmalen published a book titled "Das Neue Ostland" in which he argued for the annexation of the Baltic territories and the settlement of native Germans in the area. After the surrender of Soviet Russia in 1917 during the First World War, there were discussions of forming a dynastic union between the German Empire and the Duchy of Lithuania. With our victory in the war on the eastern front, the realization of these ideas can be put into motion.\n \nMuch like our settlement of Bialystok, the direct border of Lithuania with eastern Prussia has made the colonization of this area proceed more smoothly than in our other interests. Administration of Lithuania is now composed entirely of Germans, and governance of Lithuania, now known as Memelland, is completely subordinate to us.
Yet another territory that is rightfully German.
Generalplan Ost - Memel-Narew: Phase Three

The bordering provinces between the state of Memelland and Belarus have presented unique challenges for the Ostministerium. This line of demarcation, loosely established by the maximum extent of the conquests of the Teutonic Knights, is now firmly under our control. Resentment from the native population was particularly pronounced in these areas as local governors were sacked from their positions and replaced with German officials. Germanization of western Belarus will take quite some time, as this land has little native Germanic elements that we can utilize to assist us in the process.\n \nWith our establishment of settlements along this eastern frontier, the organic borders of the Reich have reached their greatest extent eastward. Only the lands in Estonia, now called Dunaland, remain to be integrated in our colonization of the Memel-Narew zone.
Lithuania and Belarus will become footnotes in history.
Generalplan Ost - Memel-Narew: Phase Four

The territory of Latvia has a long history with the Germanic people, including the dominion of the Livonian Order that was established in the 13th century. The city of Riga, already having a substantial number of native Germans residing in it upon our conquest over the Soviet Union, has been very useful as a central hub for the complex logistics involved in establishing German settlements along the Baltic coast and into the interior of the Baltic area.\n \nThe final stages of our consolidation over former Lithuana and Latvia are nearing completion. The empowerment of native Baltic Germans that have lived in this land for centuries has accelerated our colonization efforts, and they have gladly embraced their identity as part of the Greater Germanic Reich, bringing Kurland under our control.
We come as liberators to native Germans in the east.
Generalplan Ost - Memel-Narew: Final Integration
Our colonization of Memel-Narew has reached the level where we can turn over this territory to be integrated into the Reich.
The Reichskommissariat has succeeded in its goals!
Generalplan Ost - Ingermannland: Phase One

The land contained within southern Ingermannland was the Germanic pilgrim's first destination for the drive towards our far eastern borders. With the shores of Lake Peipus to the west and the stronghold of Holmgard to the east, we have completed the first steps in settling this distant territory of the Reich.
 
The city of Novgorod, now rechristened "Holmgard", was the easternmost trading post of the Hanseatic League that was once economically dominant over trade in the Baltic Sea. Our renaming of this key city is also in honor of the mythical Norse sagas that told stories of this land in ancient times.
 
Our settlers have established homesteads and farms in the area, and German administrators control all of the day to day operations in Holmgard. The city will serve as the nexus of our expanding influence as we move north towards the Baltic coast, and then eventually into the heart of Russia itself.
Holmgard stands as our bastion in the east.
Generalplan Ost - Ingermannland: Phase Two

Finally, after several years of the efforts of volkisch Wehrbauer to civilize and cultivate the heart of Ingermannland, we have been able to firmly establish our control over the Baltic coast, the areas to the north of Holmgard, and establish a settlement in Adolfsburg. The old ruins of Leningrad have been completely swept away, its degenerate influence having been cleansed by the purifying fires of the Reich.
 
In its place, small German hamlets are beginning to dot the landscape as our consolidation of the east continues. Adolfsburg will be the new gateway to the east once this area has been completely Germanized, and progress on the new city is now far enough along that it can begin serving as a hub for supplies and transportation for our brave pilgrims.
 
Enough time has passed that we are now seeing our settlers establish trade routes from Holmgard to the Baltic Sea, and reports of harassment by the native population have now all but disappeared. This territory that was unjustly stolen from the Swedish Empire in 1710 has now returned to its rightful Germanic-Nordic owners, the only ones capable of cultivating this distant countryside into a shining beacon of prosperity.
The new city of Adolfsburg stands as a testament to our will.
Generalplan Ost - Ingermannland: Phase Three

With the growing prosperity of Holmgard and Adolfsburg, our Wehrbauer have expanded their settlements to the east, our first true penetration into the heartland of what used to be Russia.
 
The success of our colonization of Ingermannland has inspired Nordic settlers from the Scandinavian territories, supported by our recruitment campaigns. We have instilled in them a sense of reclamation of the land that rightfully belonged to the domain of the old Swedish Empire. Similar to the Homestead Act that was used by the United States to encourage settlement into their frontier territories, we have granted free parcels of land to those whom are bold enough to stake a new life for themselves in this wilderness. We owe much of our success to to Goebbels and his brilliant propaganda campaigns.
 
Now that the cities of Holmgard and Adolfsburg have firmly consolidated control in their respective zones of administration, our final push into Ingermannland has began. What was so unjustly Russified will now be Germanized.
What the Swedish Empire lost, the Reich has reclaimed.
Generalplan Ost - Ingermannland: Phase Four

The very heart of Russia now feels the powerful blow of the German peasant's spade as his strength and indomitable will has civilized this barbaric land. Only the strongest, most resilient stock of the Wehrbauer have survived here, and the ones that have been lost will be forever immortalized in the Hall of the Ost-Pilger, a special monument commissioned by the Führer to honor the sacrifices made by our brave eastern pilgrims that have subdued these lands for the future of European civilization.\n \nOur colonization of Ingermannland has now reached the designated eastern border that was drawn by the Ostministerium. The final steps required for incorporation of this territory into the Reich are now underway. Finding a sufficient number of settlers to lay down roots here has been a difficult task, but we know that the security of this distant territory depends on the success of these efforts.
The heart of Russia now pulses with Germanic blood.
Generalplan Ost - Ingermannland: Final Integration
Our colonization of Ingermannland has reached the level where we can turn over this territory to be integrated into the Reich.
The Reichskommissariat has succeeded in its goals!
Generalplan Ost - Ingermannland: Final Integration
Our colonization of Ingermannland has reached the level where we can turn over this territory to be integrated into the Reich.
The Reichskommissariat has succeeded in its goals!
Generalplan Ost - Baku: Phase One

The acquisition of the Caucasus oil fields with the city of Baku as a central point of administration is the most valuable single asset gained from Operation Barbarossa. Our investment into the region is well underway, with the German companies Ost-Ol and Karpaten-Ol granted 99-year exclusive contracts in the region for the extraction of crude oil.\n \nEstablishment of the so-called "Liberation Committee" of Azerbaijan has been set up as a satellite governing body of the Reich, and the integration of our German administrators into the region is making rapid progress. The first construction phase of critical infrastructure, including modern RADAR and defensive fortifications, has been completed.
Baku will become the Reich's fortress in the east.
Generalplan Ost - Baku: Phase Two

Progress on Baku is proceeding as scheduled, and a team of German specialists are now conducting surveys in the area. The "Technical Oil Brigade" consists of 15,000 highly capable technicians and engineers that have been hand-picked from across Europe in order to construct the most sophisticated oil extraction and refining facilities that the world has ever seen.\n \nOil in this region is extremely close to the surface, enabling us to utilize forced labor to reap results almost immediately. With the success of Operation Barbarossa, however, we are investing into more long-term strategies to make full use of the resources underneath this precious territory.
German engineering will astound the world, yet again.
Generalplan Ost - Baku: Phase Three

Now that the preparation of key industrial and military facilities in Baku is nearing completion, focus has shifted onto tightening our grip over the territory itself. German administrators have taken control of virtually every aspect of daily life in the region, and the local Azeri have grown to accept our rule. The high demand for new labor has prompted a number of German settlers from all over the world to relocate to this area, already causing a considerable demographic shift in Baku itself.\n \nWith the investment of time and appropriate policies, this region may become Germanized. While this is not our specific intent at the moment, it is undeniably an element that we are openly embracing. A interesting fusion of far eastern culture and Germanic influence is creating one of the most distinct communities in the world.
Germanic volk find their home even in the Caucasus mountains.
Generalplan Ost - Baku: Final Integration
Our colonization of Baku has reached the level where we can turn over this territory to be integrated into the Reich.
The Reichskommissariat has succeeded in its goals!
The Polish Question

Now that Operation Barbarossa has concluded and our strategic goals in the east have been achieved, our attention can be focused elsewhere. One matter in particular requires your direct involvement, a lingering topic that calls out for a resolution and a definitive answer - the Polish Question.
 
The final result of the First World War would be the first time in over 100 years that the Polish state would exist as an independent political entity. The blitzkrieg in 1939 smashed the very existence of this state, and territory that is rightfully German such as Danzig, the so-called Polish corridor, Posen, Wartheland, and Bialystok will remain in our hands regardless of what we ultimately choose to do.
 
A decision must be made. We can choose to begin a program of Germanization under the administration of the Generalgouvernement, maintain the status quo and allow our occupation regime to continue existing, or immediately dissolve the Generalgouvernement and occupy Poland directly. Note that if we choose the final option, we will be unable to sufficiently Germanize the territory and we will not gain national provinces. If we choose to Germanize the Polish state, it will take several years before it will be ready for incorporation into the Reich. The fate of Poland lies in your hands.
All of Poland must become as German as the Rhineland.
Maintain the status quo. Poland will remain occupied.
Dissolve the Generalgouvernement immediately.
Fate of Poland
The Reich has decided to Germanize all of Poland!
Warsaw has risen! Grind them to dust!
Germanization of Poland: Phase One

The first steps of the Germanization of Poland have been completed. Leveraging existing German populations in districts Krakau and Lublin, we have elevated these natives to positions of power within their local governments, allowing them to grant special concessions and favor to Germanic settlers we have brought in from all over Europe. The marginalization of the existing Polish population will ensure that in 15 to 20 years, all of Poland will be on an irrevocable demographic shift.\n \nWe expect to be able to dismiss the Generalgouvernement well before this amount of time is needed, but for now it will facilitate establishing German families within Poland. Now that the districts of Warschau, Radom and Galizien have been separated from each other by these efforts, collaboration among the native Poles will be much more difficult. The next steps of Germanization are now underway.
Never again will the Poles defy our will.
Germanization of Poland: Phase Two

With the establishment of German schools all across the former territory of Poland, we are educating select Polish children to identify as Germans. This process is carefully monitored by the Ostministerium to ensure that only the desired elements within the native Polish population will become part of our nation, and these efforts are already having the desired effect.\n \nDistrict Radom is now sufficiently Germanized that our efforts can now focus on the two remaining Polish strongholds - district Warschau and district Galizien.
Control the youth, control the future.
Germanization of Poland: Phase Three

All across the territory administered by the Generalgouvernement, there are no longer any native Poles in positions of power. The official state language has been German for many years, and any citizen that wishes to have a share of influence for himself has no choice but to be Germanized and undergo a thorough evaluation by the Ostministerium.\n \nDistrict Warschau has finally been Germanized to the degree that all daily operations are closely under the supervision of hand-selected officials. In the former Polish capital, all existing signs and street names have been completely replaced by German equivalents. The Polish language has been greatly diminished in daily usage, and anyone that dares to breach this understanding is dealt with appropriately. Only district Galizien remains before our grip over all of what used to be Poland will be completed.
The city must be referred to as Warschau, as it should be.
Germanization of Poland: Phase Four

As the watchful eye of the Generalgouvernement now penetrates all aspects of daily life under its authority, the final district of Galizien is now on an unstoppable path to future Germanization. This territory that once belonged to the Austro-Hungarian Empire became part of our puppet Polish state during the invasion of the Soviet Union, expanding its overall territory by almost twice of what it originally encompassed.\n \nThe final steps to transform Poland into a proper Reichsgau are now underway, and we expect to incorporate it into the Reich within only another year or so.
We continue to clean up the remains of Austria-Hungary.
Germanization of Poland: Final Integration
Our colonization of Poland has reached the level where we can turn over this territory to be integrated into the Reich.
The Reichskommissariat has succeeded in its goals!
Generalplan Ost - Incorporation of Gotengau

The construction of a beautiful national park commemorates one of the most critical moments in the history of the thousand-year Reich - the incorporation of Gotengau and the abundant fields of Ukraine. Though it has taken many years and an enormous investment of resources, Gotengau has been sufficiently Germanized to be incorporated directly into the Greater Germanic Reich. Official administration of the region has passed from the Reichskommissariat to our control. The process of Germanization will still take many more generations, but the foundations have been laid.
 
To celebrate the realization of his vision, the Führer and Heirich Himmler have taken a public tour across the ancient Gothic homeland of Crimea and communal farms in Ukraine. German farmers look on as the procession drives by toward their final destination in Theodorichshafen. The Wehrbauer of this region are presented with the highest decorations of German society, celebrated as heroes for their contributions to the future of European civilization. Their large families gather around to cheer for their fathers and husbands as they proudly accept these honors.
 
Never again will this heartland of abundance be threatened by destructive conflicts. We have triumphed!
Ukraine will forever be the cornucopia of the Reich.
Generalplan Ost - Incorporation of Memel-Narew

A momentous occasion is upon us. In celebration of the colonization efforts in the Baltic territories, a grand procession has began moving from Konigsberg to Riga. Soldiers of the Wehrmacht fly the medieval banners of the Teutonic Knights and adorn themselves with the tradtional icons of the forefathers of modern Germany, much to the joy and celebration of native German families that now inhabit the countryside.\n \nIn Riga, the Führer awaits the arrival of this parade before he makes his speech before the residents of the city. It seemed like a lifetime ago that his vision of the Reich's ambitions seemed so distant, but now they are becoming a reality. Projected estimates for full Germanization are still decades away, but our investments have shown their results since the decision was made to undertake the project. Administration over the territories once known as Lithuania and Latvia have passed from the Reichskommissariat into our direct control, and these lands are now a core component of the Greater Germanic Reich. Congratulations!
Der Drang nach Osten has guided our vision to reality.
Generalplan Ost - Incorporation of Ingermannland

A grand celebration is taking place in the new city of Adolfsburg. Germans and Scandinavians alike cheer as the Führer and his entourage sail into port. The Germanization of Ingermannland has reached the accepted threshold as designated by the Ostministerium for official incorporation into the Reich itself, and administration of the territory has passed from the Reichskommissariat into our hands.\n \nAs the crowds cheer in the newly paved roads of Adolfsburg, another celebration takes place to the south in Holmgard. The Führer's inspection of his far eastern conquests went as smoothly as expected, and this land that once belonged to the Swedish Empire is now an integral part of the Greater Germanic Reich. Though it will still take decades of settlement before this land can truly be called German, we are well on our way to accomplishing this transformative endeavor. Where there was once only wilderness and the chaos of native savagery, we have brought the light of civilization to the far east and reversed the Russification that set it back by so many years. Well done!
This bulwark of civilization shall forever be German.
Generalplan Ost - Incorporation of Baku

The region of Baku has received the most focused and specialized attention out of any of the eastern conquests gained from Operation Barbarossa. After the approval of Generalplan Ost, enormous resources were poured into this area to ensure that it would become the pulsing heart that would supply the Reich with critical oil. State-of-the-art facilities including heavy industry, land fortifications, a fully equipped air base and RADAR have been constructed. Administration of the zone has become Germanized to the degree that control has passed from our Reichskommissariat directly to us.\n \nAs the Führer's personal plane lands in the city of Baku, local German and Azeri families gather around to celebrate his arrival. He has made a special trip to tour the facilities of his most prized conquest. Engineers have staged a technical demonstration of an oil well for his arrival, a brilliant showcase of German engineering. As the black gold surges into the skies, the Führer and his entourage look on in awe at the realization of his vision. Baku will forever be part of the Reich!
Our civilization spans from the Baltic to the Caspian.
Germanization of Poland: Incorporation

The Reichskriegsflagge is hoisted over the rebuilt city of Warschau as the Führer begins his tour of the newest Reichsgau. Where Poland once stood, there now exists a volkisch majority and German flags hanging from every building. The Germanization of Poland has reached such a level where the services of the Generalgouvernement are no longer necessary, and control of the former Polish territory has passed directly to the Reich.\n \nFor centuries, the German nation has sought to subjugate the Polish as the burgeoning numbers of its population made it necessary to seek Lebensraum in the east. Where other German statesmen have ultimately failed, we have succeeded far beyond even their greatest ambitions. Within a few more decades, the former identity of Poland will only be a curious footnote in old history books. For now, the Führer enjoys his tour beginning in Warschau all the way to the city of Kolomea in district Galizien. Poland is no more!
The Polish were worthy adversaries, and now pass into history.
Generalplan Ost - All quiet on the Ostfront
Organized rebellions in the Reichskommissariats have finally been exhausted!
Peace at least!
Generalplan Ost - All quiet on the Ostfront

A quiet wind blows across the fields of Ukraine to the forests in northern Russia. After years of pointless resistance, organized partisan groups in our Reichskommissariats have finally been exhausted. Smuggling networks used by foreign powers to arm and incite these dissidents have been wiped out by the Gestapo after intense crackdowns.\n \nAcqusition of forced labor to staff and repair the damaged factories has been enacted, giving our Reichskommissariats much better ability to stand on their own. Finally, our construction crews and migrating groups of settlers can travel in relative peace as the savagery of these lands has been finally been tamed by German will.
Finally, they cease their pointless struggle.
Generalplan Ost has been disrupted
We have lost control over our eastern conquests and Generalplan Ost has been disrupted! Our plans in the east have failed!
Disaster has befallen the Reich.
Volga ASSR defects to Germany!
The Volga ASSR has defected to Germany after our surrender!
There is nothing we can do.
The Volga Germans

Catherine the Great, Empress of All the Russias, was born a German princess and would eventually rule the Empire of Russia in the mid-18th century. In 1762, she declared an invitation for Europeans to settle in Russia and cultivate farmland. These Europeans, mostly Germans from the Rhineland and Bavaria, were allowed to retain their language and customs. Many of these Germans would settle along the Volga River, forming distinct communities.
 
This community of Germans was so substantial that in 1924, the Volga German Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic was created with a population of about 380,000 native Germans, composing two-thirds of the total population within its jurisdiction. Following the invasion of the Soviet Union, Stalin issued a formal Decree of Banishment which abolished the ASSR and began an intensive program of deportation of the native Germans in the area, fearing they would act as collaborators or spies. Almost all of these Volga Germans were deported to labor camps in central Asia and Siberia, many of whom would perish during and after the war on the eastern front.
 
With the defeat of the USSR following Operation Barbarossa, the communist regime has fallen into chaos. Many Germans that survived their forced expulsions have been able to find their way back to their old homes, inspired by the Reich's triumph. They have managed to stage an uprising in the former Volga ASSR, and have declared their allegiance to us!
Heim ins Reich! Aid these heroes!
Successful crusade against Bolshevism

The war against the Soviet Union was not solely undertaken by the armed forces of Germany. Over 20 European countries and various national groups would take part in the most titanic military operation in world history with an estimated 4,000,000 conscripts and volunteers from all over Europe that would participate in the war on the eastern front. Many of these soldiers would form the backbone of organizations such as the Waffen-SS, making them a vital contribution to the war effort.
 
Upon Hitler's declaration of war in 1941, the conflict against the Soviet Union took on a uniquely ideological tone that had not been present in the wars before the 20th century. Whereas war in the past had often been based on religious, economic, and dynastic contexts, the eruption between National Socialist Germany and Soviet Russia was based upon both Hitler's desire for Lebensraum in the east and his ideological conviction that Bolshevism was the greatest threat to European civilization and would eventually seek to dominate the entire planet.
 
This modern crusade has been successful, and we have ensured the freedom of Europe from those that would seek to enslave her and her descendants. The Asiatic hordes have been repulsed and Bolshevism curbed thanks to the selfless heroism of European soldiers. Salvation!
We are the saviors of Europe!
Heroes of the Ostfront

The bestowment of military decorations is a long-standing Prussian tradition to exemplify the service of German soldiers. After the conclusion of Operation Barbarossa, the Führer immediately ordered the creation of a series of "Ostfront" medals to commemorate the soldiers that bravely fought against the Bolshevisk menace. Any serviceman that participated in the conflict would be awarded with a "Hero of the Ostfront" medal to immortalize the commitment to his duty, many of them awarded posthumously.\n \nSpecial awards such as the "Knight of Moscow" and "Shield of Stalingrad" were also awarded to those who participated in key battles that saw the fall of major Soviet cities. German field marshals that supervised Operation Barbarossa were rewarded with the "Grand Cross of the Ostfront", an honor that had no equal among all the decorations awarded in the Third Reich.
We owe everything to our 20th century knights.
Spoils from the East

By right of conquest, we claim the spoils of war. After the conclusion of Operation Barbarossa, the Germans looted what they could in order to sustain their economy and future prospects. Valuable assets and material from the east have been transferred to our stockpiles.
A practice as old as mankind.
We have looted all that we can.
Glory of the Reich

After assuming power in the German Reich in 1933, the cult of personality that formed around Adolf Hitler has grown stronger with each passing year. Hitler's diplomatic maneuvering and statesmanship resurrected Germany from the humiliation of the Treaty of Versailles and catapulted Germany from utter collapse to one of the most powerful nations in the world. Embodying the will of the Reich in the focused intent of a single man, Hitler has defeated all who have stood in his way. The Fall of France in 1940 shocked the planet, many of whom believed that France still possessed the strongest land army in the world. What the Second Reich failed to accomplish in 4 years in the terrible waste of the First World War, the Third Reich achieved in less than two months.
 
Now that the Soviet Union has also fallen to the will of the Führer and the strength of German steel, there are few that stand in the way of his New Order. While Operation Barbarossa took place, the world was watching. The legitimacy of National Socialist ideology has proven itself on the battlefield, and the people of the world are adjusting their worldview accordingly.
 
"The great strength of the totalitarian state is that it forces those who fear it to imitate it." - Adolf Hitler
In a clash of ideologies, the strongest will prevail.
Fascism on the rise

The incredible victories of the Third Reich are not going unnoticed by the people of our nation - the fall of the Soviet Union is making many of them believe in the legitimacy of Adolf Hitler and his ideas!
The world is a volatile place.
Destruction of Kiev

One of Adolf Hitler's goals in the war against the Soviet Union was the complete annihilation of historic Russian cities such as Kiev, Moscow, Stalingrad (Volgagrad) and Leningrad (St. Petersburg). The purpose of this destruction was both ideologically and racially motivated, as he believed that the razing of these historical cities would be a demonstration of his conviction to annihilate both Bolshevist ideology and major Russian population centers. This would serve as show of force against local partisan groups and remove major resistance cells, along with effectively erasing the existence of the native people from these regions to pave the way for his vision of the Reich's future civilization.\n \nNow that the war with the Soviet Union is over and our forces have began pacifying the eastern conquests, these demolition projects may begin. Kiev is the first location slated to be removed from the map. This idea has met some resistance in the party, particularly from Himmler who refers to Kiev as "Kiroffo", believing that it may be the grounds of an ancient Germanic city. A decision must be made for the future of these cities.
Raze Kiev and all of the other cities to the ground.
These operations are unnecessary.
Capital moves to Rowne
With the destruction of Kiev, our center of administration of the Reichskommissariat has moved to Rowne.
Very well.
Destruction of Leningrad

The capture of Leningrad, along with Moscow and Stalingrad, was one of the three primary strategic goals of Operation Barbarossa. By 1939, Leningrad was an manufacturing center accounting for nearly 11 percent of the Soviet Union's industrial output. Its symbolic importance as both the former capital of Russia and the center of the Russian Revolution also made it a vital location to achieve a decisive victory over the Soviet Union. Once known as St. Petersburg, the city had been renamed in honor of Vladimir Lenin after the formation of the USSR. It has been said that Hitler was so confident in the capture of the city that he had already printed invitations for victory celebrations in the Hotel Astoria located there.\n \nNow that the victory party is over, the order to destroy the city has been issued. In its place, the new city of Adolfsburg will be constructed to serve as the capital of the Ingermannland province as per the decree in Generalplan Ost.
The tumor of the Bolshevisk Revolution must be excised.
Commission of Adolfsburg
With the destruction of Leningrad, the new city of Adolfsburg has been commissioned in its place.
Great!
Destruction of Moscow

The Soviet capital city of Moscow was a critical component in both German war aims and Red Army logistics during the war on the eastern front. A historic Russian city, also a core transit and population center, it was the political seat of power for Stalin and his party.
 
Hitler and his generals disagreed on the significance of capturing the city during Operation Barbarossa. While the generals of the Wehrmacht believed in the classic wartime strategy of seizing an enemy's capital to force a surrender, Hitler believed that the nature of modern warfare demanded that capturing an enemy's industrial and resource base was the only way to achieve success, and thus focused the campaign's attention on Ukraine and then moving towards the oil fields in the Caucasus. Whether or not the capture of Moscow in 1941 would have caused the capitulation of the USSR is still a popular topic of discussion today.
 
With the city in German hands, Hitler's vision for the fate of Moscow will now be enacted. All valuable works of art and historic relics have been evacuated from the city to be showcased in museums to teach future generations. Moscow will be completely leveled and the remains transformed into an artificial lake via the destruction of the Moscow-Volga canal. Administration of Reichskommissariat Moskowien will be moved to the future site of Adolfsburg.
The very heart of Russia must be submerged.
Capital moves to Adolfsburg
With the destruction of Moscow, the new city of Adolfsburg will become the capital of Reichskommissariat Moskowien.
Great!
Destruction of Stalingrad

Stalingrad, a historic Russian city situated on the banks of the Volga River, was another critical objective for the Wehrmacht during the war on the eastern front. Known as "Tsaritsyn" for centuries until the Bolshevisk Revolution, it was rennamed "Stalingrad" in honor of Josef Stalin. The capture of this city was seen by Adolf Hitler as an important symbolic objective, bearing Stalin's namesake and serving as an important transit and logistical hub for the Red Army.
 
Historically, the Wehrmacht controlled up to 90 percent of the city during the legendary Battle of Stalingrad. Ultimately, German blitzkrieg tactics failed to subdue the city and it would serve as the breakwater point for German expansion where it began to recede upon the decisive defeat and loss of the entire German 6th Army.
 
Hitler has decreed the annihilation of this last major Soviet city, motivated primarily by a desire to wipe Stalin's name from the historical record. The city will be razed to the ground without prejudice, destroying a potential hub of resistance and achieving another symbolic victory for the Reich.
Stalingrad will not even be a memory decades from now.
Commission of Wolgaburg
With the destruction of Stalingrad, the new city of Wolgaburg has been commissioned in its place.
Great!
Refugees from the west
As the Germans continue to terrorize our lost territories, waves of refugees pour in from across the Volga.
Equip and train them.
Place them in the reserves.
The USSR has surrendered

As expected by diplomatic analysts, the USSR has surrendered. This radically changes the balance of power across the globe, and we must adjust our policies accordingly. Some of our citizens are concerned that we may be the next target of Hitler's conquests, and have formed protection squadrons to defend the homeland.
We must be vigilant.
The Icebreaker

After the beginning of Operation Barbarossa, it quickly became clear that the Soviet Union had been enormously underestimated. Upon commencing the invasion, it was discovered that the USSR had hundreds of divisions that were not accounted for by initial intelligence reports, and possessed the largest land army ever seen in human history. Only through the lightning precision of the German blitzkrieg were these forces effectively neutralized and victory was achieved. If the Reich had been locked into a war of attrition, defeat would have been inevitable against the overwhelming numbers and industrial resources of the Red Army.
 
Following the German victory, important documents were found in Moscow that revealed Stalin's shocking plans - he had intended to use Hitler to wear down the western Allies and then strike from the east, seizing a weakened Europe and spreading the Bolshevik revolution from the Pacific to the Atlantic, and from there, the entire planet!
 
Only through a preemptive strike was Germany able to save Europe from this nightmarish scenario. As Hitler delivers a public broadcast to the world detailing this sinister communist scheme, he cites these documents and the titanic size of the Red Army as evidence that speaks for itself. Stalin's idea of using Hitler as an "icebreaker" to soften the world for his Red Dawn sends chills through families everywhere as they listen intently to Hitler's speech. Thanks to the vigilance of the Third Reich, the world has been saved from a terrible fate.
History will be kind to me, for I intend to write it.
Dismantle the Stalin Line

The Stalin Line was a series of fortifications first established in the 1920s to protect the USSR against attacks from the west. The fortifications were designed to funnel invaders along specific channels to assist in defending an enormously long geographic front, with the line stretching all the way from the Baltic coast to the border of Ukraine. When the Germans invaded in 1941, much of the line was unfinished and in disrepair, and thus of little use against the blitzkrieg.\n \nWe may dismantle these fortifications and reuse the materials for ourselves now that our eastern border has been established far beyond this frontier.
Dismantle the fortifications and reuse the materials.
Leave the line intact.
Motorization of the East

One of Adolf Hitler's long-term goals after the conquest of Russia was the construction of a modern highway and railway system to facilitate transportation from Germany proper into its eastern frontiers. After the war had been won in its entirety, these networks would expand to cover all of Europe and potentially all the way to India and beyond the Urals.\n \nThis modern transportation network would serve the Reich's economic and logistical interests, forming the arteries of the New Order and backbone of a National Socialist inspired concept of Mitteleuropa. The first major tracks have been laid from Berlin to Silesia, from where our highways and railways will branch out towards the east.
Begin building der Ost Autobahn und Breitspurbahn.
Motorization of the East - Poland
Major highway and railway networks have been completed in the Poland region, with Warschau and Lemberg becoming central hubs. This prepares us for further expansion into Russia and Ukraine.
Continue the construction.
Motorization of the East - Russia
Major highway and railway networks have been completed in Russia, linking us to the Moscow reservoir and Adolfsburg. Minsk has also become a major logistics hub for our settlement of the east.
We are paving the way for civilization.
Motorization of the East - Ukraine

Major highway and railway networks have been completed in Ukraine, with the former site of Kiev now serving as a logistics hub. Railways and highways stretch southwards to Theodorichshafen and to the east in Wolgaburg. The last major network to be completed will run from Rostov to Baku.
The route to Baku must now be laid.
Motorization of the East - Caucasus

Major highway and railway networks have been completed from Rostov to Baku. This will allow us to transport oil from our far eastern frontier and rapidly respond to any incursions in the area. The completion of this sector also allows us to free up some of the resources invested into Generaplan Ost.
Trains and automobiles will flow across these lands.
South Tyrol Option Agreement

The South Tyrol Option Agreement refers to the period between 1939 and 1943 where the native German population of South Tyrol, ceded to Italy since the end of the First World War, was given the option of emigrating to the Greater Germanic Reich or being assimilated into Italy. Historically, over 80 percent of the residents of the area opted to move to Germany.
 
The question of ownership of South Tyrol met with fiercely competing opinions among German and Italian nationalists, both between each other and within their own groups. Although the area predominantly spoke the German language, Italian irredentist theories claimed that the population was ethnically Italian and had been Germanized over the course of centuries. After the Austrian Anschluss, Adolf Hitler decided to settle this dispute with Mussolini by formally renouncing claims to the province and used this to gain diplomatic leverage with the Italian fascist leader.
 
With Generalplan Ost well underway, many Germans in this territory have been granted incentives to take part in the colonization of the east, including land grants, fully equipped farms, military protection and other state-sponsored programs from the Reich to assist in the settlement of their new homes. Similar programs are also taking place in Elsass-Lothringen, the Low Countries and Schleswig-Holstein.
We must find colonists wherever we can.
Manifest Destiny

The term "Manifest Destiny" typically refers to the 19th century expansionist doctrine of the United States into its westward frontier. The spirit of American exceptionalism imbued the new nation with an powerful sense of its own destiny to cover the American continent from coast to coast. It was the essential duty of the American people to civilize an untamed, wild land inhabited by native savages. Framing this concept in a sociological perspective, this was the American nation's "conquest" phase where a nascent tribe surges forth with raw energy, eager to test its strength and prove itself on the world stage.
 
Adolf Hitler took great inspiration from this concept, consistently referring to the USA as the "American Union" and praising the idea of Manifest Destiny. He expressed his admiration for the Anglo-Saxon nation's successful acquisition of western Lebensraum in various literature, including Mein Kampf. Hitler viewed the American subjugation of its native populations as a parallel to his own ambitions of conquering European Russia for essential living space and resources needed to ensure the Reich's survival and independence.
 
As Generalplan Ost makes progress, Hitler has made various speeches exemplifying the ideology of social darwinism taken to its natural conclusion, that the weaker races of the planet must inevitably be subjugated by the stronger in order for mankind as a whole to progress and for civilization to flourish. He continues to use the historical example of the United States as a basis for this philosophy, causing great debate among those interested in the topic.
Truly, this earth is a trophy cup for the industrious man.
Blut und Boden

The concept of "Blut und Boden" (Blood and Soil) is an ideology of German origin that emphasizes the relationship of a nation to both its blood ancestry and the land that it cultivates. It is a philosophy that strongly emphasizes agrarian life and the peasant's connection to the soil of the land, decrying the corrupting influence of modern urbanization and its negative effects on a nation's spirit. Strong men and women, the backbone of a healthy nation, can only be raised in an environment where a nigh-divine connection exists between them and the soil that they live upon.\n \nForming a core principle of Adolf Hitler's desire for Lebensraum, Blut und Boden is the driving ideology behind the settlements established in Generalplan Ost. Advertised as a way for the German worker to escape from the stifling, unnatural existence of urban life, the Blut und Boden propaganda campaign has been successful in attracting German families to abandon the city in the interest of seeking a new, more fundamental purpose on the German frontier.
The liberation of the German soul will be found in this new soil.
Wehrbauer

Wehrbauer, which translates to "soldier peasant" in English, is a concept used by the SS that refers to soldiers that are to be designated as the initial settlers of the conquered lands of the east.
 
Similar to the medieval Ordensburgen which fortified territory against natives in the Baltics, these soldier peasants would not only serve as the base for Germanization in the east, but provide for their own defense against native uprisings and resistance to the colonization process. These men would primarily be composed of veterans of the SS and given land grants as rewards for their service in the German military.
 
Hitler detailed his vision for the soldier peasant during one of his dinner meetings recorded by Martin Bormann. After twelve years of service, these veterans were to be given equipped and furnished farms in the eastern territories. A heavy focus on agricultural education and an emphasis on raising large families with peasant wives would ensure a strong foundation for the Blut und Boden philosophy to become incorporated into the eastern conquests, ensuring Germanization over the course of a few generations. As Generalplan Ost progresses, these Wehrbauer are critical to the success of our settlement of the east, and every available resource has been allocated to ensuring their prosperity.
Only German blood can create German soil.
The Ural Mountains

In 1725, geographer Philip Johan von Strahlenberg printed the first recorded designation of the Ural Mountains as the eastern demarcation between Europe and Asia. Adolf Hitler believed that the Urals only formed a geographic designation - it would require the Germanization of the former Russian territories for the Ural Mountains to truly represent the far eastern border of Europe itself, and was the long-term ambition behind the conquest of the USSR.\n \n"The real frontier is the one that separates the Germanic world from the Slav world. It is our duty to place it where we want it to be. If anyone asks where we obtain the right to extend the Germanic space to the east, we reply that, for a nation, its awareness of what it represents carries this right with. It is success that justifies everything. The reply to such questions can only be of an empirical nature. It is inconceivable that a higher people should painfully exist on a soil too narrow for it, while amorphous masses, which contribute nothing to civilization, occupy infinite tracts of a soil that is one of the richest in the world... We must create conditions for our people that favour its multiplication, and we must at the same time build a dike against the Russian flood [...] Since there is no natural protection against such a flood, we must meet it with a living wall. A permanent war on the eastern front will help form a sound race of men, and will prevent us from relapsing into the softness of a Europe thrown back upon itself. It should be possible for us to control this region to the east with two hundred and fifty thousand men plus a cadre of good administrators... This space in Russia must always be dominated by Germans." - Adolf Hitler
Only German blood can create German soil.
Operation Charlemagne

After the success of Operation Barbarossa, the Third Reich focused its attention toward consolidating control over its conquests west of the Volga River. Meanwhile, the remnant of the USSR held a fragile grip onto its remaining assets in the Ural mountains, Central Asia, and Siberia. Thanks to Stalin's decision to move a large amount of the USSR's heavy industry into the Urals and Siberia, the industrial capacity of the revolutionary state was still enough to sustain what elements of the Red Army were not destroyed by the German blitzkrieg. Though they have been unable to do little but look across the Volga from the east, the Soviets still present a potential threat to the New Order.\n \nYears have passed since the conclusion of the first war against the USSR, and the Third Reich stands stronger than ever. Hitler's dream of expanding Europe's borders to the Urals is still unfulfilled - political practicality and the realities of the challenges presented by Operation Barbarossa prevented this from being attainable during our first peace treaty with the Bolshevik menace. Now is the time to eradicate Bolshevism from the face of the planet, for the protection of Europe and to fulfill the destiny of the Reich!
From the Atlantic to the Urals! Forward!
Struggle for existence
The Reich has declared war upon us yet again, determined to destroy the glorious revolution! This is our last chance at survival!
To arms, comrades!
Partition of the USSR

Now that the Soviet Union has been completely destroyed, we need to manage our new territories. If we are allied with Japan, we will split our conquests based on the demarcation of the Yenisei River, as agreed upon. Otherwise, we will divide our conquests among Reichskommissariats and a Siberian protectorate state. If we took down the USSR on our own, we also have the option of claiming Vladivostok to serve as a military base and logistics hub on the Pacific coast.
Cede territory to Japan based upon our agreement.
Claim Vladivostok as our bastion in the east.
We have no need for Vladivostok.
Patrition of the USSR

Now that the Soviet Union has been completely destroyed, we need to manage our new territories. Since we are allied with Germany, we will cede them any provinces west of the Yenisei River that came under our control, as agreed upon.
Cede territory to Germany based upon our agreement.
Destruction of Bolshevism

To Adolf Hitler, the ideology of Bolshevism represented the single greatest threat to European civilization. Rejecting Marxist socialism, he wrote in Mein Kampf and frequently spoke about the destructive nature of communistic thought, believing that it was the final manifestation of Judaic infiltration into western society. This doctrine would eventually lead to the enslavement of all Europeans, and eventually the entire world under their Jewish masters.
 
Hitler also believed that the ideology of social democracy practiced by the Allied powers was little more than a preliminary stage of Bolshevist evolution, a view that was heavily influenced by his experience living in the Weimar Republic. The infection of Jewish international financiers and their grip over the peoples of the planet was facilitated by these forms of government, and he believed that only the Aryan race and the doctrine of National Socialism had the strength to wage a war of complete annihilation on those whom would seek to enslave Germany and the rest of the world.
 
Finally, the Soviet Union has been destroyed and with it, the incubation chamber for all forms of Bolshevism and Marxist thought. As Hitler makes his victory speech, he hails the Wehrmacht's success as not just another victory for Germany, but the assurance of the continuance of western civilization. Congratulations!
Hail Victory! We are the saviors of mankind!
Expansion of Reichskommissariat Moskowien

Although Reichskommissariat Moskowien was not established in real history, it was planned for creation once the Wehrmacht had made sufficient progress and it would have become a critical component of Adolf Hitler's vision for his transformation of the east. Predicted to be the most difficult to manage and integrate out of all of the administrative divisions formed after the conquest of the USSR, it was to encompass territory all the way from Arkhangelsk to as far as the city of Sverdlovsk.\n \nNow that the Soviet Union has been obliterated, we can expand the borders of this Reichskommissariat to the Irtysh and Ob rivers, creating both a healthy buffer zone just to the east of the Urals and absorbing the Russian settlements in the mountains themselves. By doing so, the realization of Hitler's vision for Europe's geographical borders can finally be made a reality and our Wehrbauer can begin forming the "living wall" of the east to protect us from any incursions that burst forth from Siberia and Asia.
We have drawn the map of the next thousand years.
Continue the occupation of the Urals.
Creation of Reichskommissariat Turkestan

The predominantly Muslim populations of Central Asia had a long-standing antagonism with Russia since the 19th century. Falling under Russian influence as part of the "Great Game" geopolitical maneuvering between the Russian and British Empires, Central Asia would eventually become part of the USSR in the form of Soviet Socialist Republics.
 
Alfred Rosenberg proposed the creation of a Reichskommissariat in this region, though this was rejected by Adolf Hitler until the conquests in Europe could be consolidated.
 
Little more than a historical curiosity in reality, the concept of a German-dominated "Panturkestan", or "Mohammed-Reich" can now be created from our conquest of the USSR. We are prepared to install a German civil administration into the former Central Asian SSRs, we can choose to create client states based upon local ethnic divisions, or continue the occupation of this territory.
We are the final victors of the Great Game.
Create nationalist Central Asian states instead.
Continue the occupation of Central Asia.
Creation of the Siberian Protectorate

The unique challenges posed by the occupation of Siberia in combination with Generalplan Ost need to handled with care and scrutiny. The annexation of territory beyond the Ural Mountains is not only a logistical nightmare, but could be a risk to our long-term goals. The Ostministerium has proposed the creation of a Siberian protectorate state that would serve a number of critical functions in the New Order.\n \nFirst, the deportations of native populations from our conquests need to be managed effectively. This Siberian protectorate would exist to absorb these populations and handle them appropriately, ensuring that insurgency in our eastern conquests is kept to a minimum. Economic exploitation of the vast resources of Siberia would also be facilitated through this regime. Finally, if we have reached an agreement with Japan, this state will serve as an effective buffer zone between our two empires. This protectorate would be fully subordinate to us, and would become an extension of the Reich and its future interests on the continent.
An elegant solution to managing a continent.
Continue the occupation of Siberia.

The challenges posed by Generalplan Ost were monumental and would challenge every aspect of the Reich's capabilities. The general flow of administrating these lands is proceeding much more smoothly, and our resources can now be allocated elsewhere.
Continue development of the east.
